= Eclipse + Maven Integration =

== Maven ==

  # Download Maven [http://maven.apache.org/download.html]
  # Setup Maven very quickly: [http://maven.apache.org/guides/getting-started/maven-in-five-minutes.html]
  # You need to define an environment variable *M2_HOME*; in *~/.bash_profile* or  *~/.profile*, add the following line:
{{{
export M2_HOME=/path/to/apache-maven
export PATH=$PATH:$M2_HOME/bin
}}}
  # Create a directory under *M2_HOME/repo*
  # Edit settings file under *M2_HOME/conf/settings.xml* and add a local repository:
{{{
   <localRepository>/path/to/apache-maven/repo</localRepository>
}}} 
  # Create a *symbolic link* to the Maven repository by:
{{{
ln -s /path/to/apache-maven/repo ~/.m2/repository
}}}

== Eclipse + Maven Integration ==

=== Maven Repository ===
  
You only need to define a *Classpath Variable* in eclipse to do so
  # Go to *Window -> Preferences*
  # In the left side tree, go to *Java -> Build Path -> Classpath Variables*
  # Click *New...*
  # Variable name would be *M2_REPO* and the value *~/.m2/repository*
  # If you already have it then you're done.

=== Maven Dependency Management ===

To update the dependencies:

  # Open a terminal and go to */path/to/eclipse/project*
  # Run
{{{
mvn eclipse:eclipse
}}}

To have the dependency sources:
  # Open a terminal and go to */path/to/eclipse/project*
  # Run
{{{
mvn dependency:sources
mvn eclipse:eclipse
}}}
